text:
Hi, I'm Chris Manning here to answer your 
questions on artificial intelligence.

[Music] Here are a couple 
of AI-generated questions.

Considering the rapid progress in NLP what 
key factors and actions should the community

prioritize for responsible and ethical AI 
language model deployment and development?

Well it's really good to know that 
the AI systems are also thinking

about what's important for responsible 
and ethical AI language model deployment.

So, there are lots of things to think about there. 
We certainly want systems that don't exhibit

conventional gender biases or ethnic stereotypes.
The fact of the matter is that all of the current

large language models do exhibit those problems.
In part it's because these models are just trained

on a lot of historical data from the world.
You know, one of the the things that human

beings are better at is having in their 
head how they think the world should be

rather than just knowing how the world has 
been and having statistics based on that.

But there are also details of the machine learning 
models where they tend to emphasize majority

cases and forget about the minority cases.
So we should be working out how to build

models that do a better job of that. But we should 
also be trying to get data from different sources

so it represents different groups.
And we should have the preferences

of different groups involved in the 
evaluation of models. finding their

weak spots, teaching them how to behave.
So a couple of people at Stanford have

been involved in this idea of jury learning, 
Professor Michael Bernstein and his students,

and the idea there is that there isn't sort of 
one right answer to how you should behave in

many contexts, that different subgroups 
of people have different Impressions.

And so you actually want to represent 
a jury of your peers and how different

people feel about things, and so lots 
of things to explore in those areas.

AI system asks: what are some of 
the most promising and exciting

real world applications of NLP that you 
foresee emerging in the next few years?

Uh, tons! So I think we're going to see a lot 
more NLP systems being deployed very successfully

everywhere. So a lot of websites already have 
a little AI assistant in the bottom corner.

I think we're going to see a new generation 
of ones powered by large language models

which really work much more fluently.
I think we're going to see much more

use of conversational assistants. So you're 
thinking about how to word an email to your

boss, or you're not quite sure what 
you should say to your boyfriend.

It turns out that you can 
get advice, drafting help,

suggestions of what to say from a large language 
model that are actually useful these days.

You know, I think there's just a whole world 
of ways that we can use these models because

our world is so language based and that we're 
all just sort of exploring what some of the

possibilities are.
[Music]
